introduction.p: These exercises are about investigating basic properties of the integers, something we will frequently do when investigating groups. Use the editing capabilities of a Sage worksheet to annotate and explain your work.

statement.p: Use the next_prime() command to construct two different 8-digit prime numbers.
Use the .is_prime() method to verify that your primes are really prime.
Verify that the greatest common divisor of your two primes is 1.
Find two integers that make a linear combination of your primes equal to 1. Include a verification of your result.
Determine a factorization into powers of primes for b=4\,598\,037\,234.

Write statements that show that b is (i) divisible by 7, (ii) not divisible by 11. Your statements should simply return True or False and be sufficiently general that a different value of b or different candidate prime divisors could be easily used by making just one substitution/edit for each changed value.
